alert.note: Alert for Breathitt (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 06 at 3:55PM EDT until May 06 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in JACKSON KY has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Breathitt County in southeastern Kentucky... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 355 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Chenowee, or near Jackson, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Elkatawa around 400 PM EDT. Fivemile around 405 PM EDT. Jackson around 410 PM EDT. Haginsville around 415 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Rousseau. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
